intro: Haplopappus pristiphyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, linear leaves that reduce water loss. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense clusters, which are surrounded by bracts. The plant's structure and adaptations reflect its ability to thrive in arid environments.
